title: How to Pierce Your Belly Button

steps.title: Buy a belly button piercing kit.
steps.content: Buy a belly button piercing kit. Make sure that includes a 14 g piercing needle and a clamp. You'll also need sterile gloves, antiseptic, cotton balls, a body ink marker, a mirror and some jewelry. Your first piece of jewelry should be small and thin.

steps.title: Pick the location for your piercing.
steps.content: Pick the location for your piercing. Typically, people pierce an area above their navels. Hold some jewelry against your navel until you find the right angle and location. Mark both the entry point and the exit point of the jewelry on your skin using the body ink marker.

steps.title: Wash your hands with soap and water.
steps.content: Wash your hands with soap and water. Put on your sterile gloves.

steps.title: Put antiseptic on cotton balls and rub the antiseptic over the area that you plan to pierce.
steps.content: Put antiseptic on cotton balls and rub the antiseptic over the area that you plan to pierce.

steps.title: Pinch the fold of skin that you want to pierce.
steps.content: Pinch the fold of skin that you want to pierce. Use the clamp in your kit to hold the tissue in place.

steps.title: Stretch your skin taut and push the needle through in a swift motion.
steps.content: Stretch your skin taut and push the needle through in a swift motion. Pull the needle through the hole and thread the jewelry through right after the needle.

steps.title: Secure the end of your jewelry to make sure that it stays in place.
steps.content: Secure the end of your jewelry to make sure that it stays in place.

steps.title: Assess the cleanliness of the shop.
steps.content: Assess the cleanliness of the shop. Look for general tidiness and watch the artists to make sure that they wear sterile gloves and use sterile solutions on the skin. Ask them if they own an autoclave. Don't be afraid to walk out of the piercing studio if you don't feel that they are very hygienic with their piercing techniques. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Be prepared to show identification to prove you're at least 16 years of age.
steps.content: Be prepared to show identification to prove you're at least 16 years of age. You will likely be asked to sign a paper for legal purposes. If you are younger than 16, you'll probably need a parent to provide consent before the shop will perform the piercing.

steps.title: Select the jewelry you would like.
steps.content: Select the jewelry you would like. A knowledgeable piercing artist will help guide you with what type of jewelry is best for healing. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Relax in the chair or lean-to.
steps.content: Relax in the chair or lean-to. [3] X Research source On request, expose your belly button and the piercing artist will size up your navel with a felt tip marker. A surgical-type clamp will be attached to the upper region of your navel to stabilize the tissue in preparation for the puncture.

steps.title: Take a deep breath and relax as much as you can during the procedure.
steps.content: Take a deep breath and relax as much as you can during the procedure. [4] X Research source Out of the autoclave comes a very long, very sharp hollow needle of sorts, which will be used to pierce the skin for your new piercing. Your jewelry is placed on the end of the spear and guided through your new piercing. Remember to breathe throughout the procedure for maximum calm and comfort.

steps.title: Invert a cup of warm saline solution over your piercing to form a vacuum.
steps.content: Invert a cup of warm saline solution over your piercing to form a vacuum. If you don't have store-bought solution, then make your own using 1/4 teaspoon of non-iodized salt in 8 ounces of warm water. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Hold the solution in place for 5 to 10 minutes and blot the area with a piece of sterile gauze.
steps.content: Hold the solution in place for 5 to 10 minutes and blot the area with a piece of sterile gauze. Rinse the residue away with a stream of cool water. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Skip the rubbing alcohol, hydrogen peroxide or harsh soaps to avoid damaging your skin cells.
steps.content: Skip the rubbing alcohol, hydrogen peroxide or harsh soaps to avoid damaging your skin cells. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Avoid washing your piercing more than 2 times per day.
steps.content: Avoid washing your piercing more than 2 times per day. Squeeze a pearl-sized drop of soap onto the piercing and gently rub the piercing and jewelry with your fingers. Rinse the area and dry it with sterile gauze. Make sure the soap is antimicrobial and it has no scent, the fragrance will make the chances of infection higher. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Keep all bodily fluids and lotions off of your piercing.
steps.content: Keep all bodily fluids and lotions off of your piercing. Steer clear of any oral contact with your navel, and avoid applying lotions, creams or cosmetics to the wound. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Protect your piercing if you go into a lake, pool or hot tub.
steps.content: Protect your piercing if you go into a lake, pool or hot tub. Try a waterproof wound-sealant bandage, which you can get at a drugstore. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Buy a hard, vented eye patch at a drugstore.
steps.content: Buy a hard, vented eye patch at a drugstore. Put the eye patch over the piercing and secure it by wrapping a cloth bandage around your abdomen. The eye patch will help to protect your piercing if you have to wear tight clothing or engage in contact sports.

steps.title: Keep the jewelry in until the piercing has completely healed.
steps.content: Keep the jewelry in until the piercing has completely healed. Don't hang any charms off of the jewelry until the healing process is finished.
